main event: Civilians in Cheltenham, Maryland observed a bright, silent object that hovered in the sky before suddenly taking off at a high rate of speed on February 12, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as having colors of the spectrum and appearing like a bright light, but it was likely regular aircraft that overlapped visually.
The object moved in an irregular course and was visible for about 4 minutes.
No sound was heard from the object.
The observer compared the brightness of the object to the brightest star in the sky.
The observer estimated the object was about 1/10 the size of a match head against the sky.
